  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, androidx.activity.OnBackPressedDispatcherOwner, androidx.appcompat.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatCallback, androidx.core.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, androidx.core.app.ActivityCompat.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, androidx.core.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, androidx.core.view.KeyEventDispatcher.Component, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CreateSubscriptionActivity, EditSubscriptionActivity, ViewSubscriptionActivity

    public abstract class SubscriptionActivityAbstract
extends androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
    The base class for any activities that are used to display subscription data. For this application, this is the create, edit, and view activities. They all use the same view layout, but modify it slightly in their distinct subclasses based on what each view mode requires. To access any of these activities from an external activity, each subclass of this class should have a static helper method that builds an intent with the necessary information that page needs.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        When this activity is created, initialize it and load any data we need. This will do global initializations, then pass on control to the subclass to make any additional customizations.
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - any saved state needed

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(android.view.Menu menu)
        Creates the action bar menu at the top of the page. As the default implementation, this makes no changes to the menu bar.
        Overrides:
        onCreateOptionsMenu in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        menu - the menu to inflate
        Returns:
        whether creation was successful or not

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem item)
        Called when a button on the action bar is pressed. When the edit button is pressed in this activity, the edit activity will be launched, sending the subscription currently being viewed through the intent. When the delete button is pressed, display a confirmation dialog, and if yes is chosen, return to the main tab page and delete the selected item. This is always the same across all versions of this activity.
        Overrides:
        onOptionsItemSelected in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        item - the item on the action bar that was pressed
        Returns:
        whether it completed successfully or not

      • onBackPressed

        public void onBackPressed()
        Overrides the functionality of the Android back button when on a subscription page. This calls the subclass, so each subclass must specify what to do when the back button is pressed.
        Overrides:
        onBackPressed in class androidx.activity.ComponentActivity

      • submitSubscription

        public void submitSubscription(android.view.View view)
        Called when the create/update subscription button is pressed. By default, this will display an error that the button shouldn't be accessible. Subclasses can override this method to provide functionality for the submit button.
        Parameters:
        view - the current application view

      • onCreateSubclass

        public abstract void onCreateSubclass()
        Abstract method for what a subclass should do when the activity is created. This is always called after onCreate is run and the global activity properties are initialized.

      • backButton

        public abstract void backButton()
        Abstract method for providing functionality to the back button. This is called either when pressing the back button in the top left, or using the system back button.

      • parseInputFields

        protected Subscription parseInputFields(android.view.View view)
        Parse the input fields in the current view and build a subscription object from them. This will display an error message and return null if one of the fields is invalid.
        Parameters:
        view - the current application view, if null then error bars won't display
        Returns:
        a Subscription object if everything is valid, null otherwise

      • getNotifDropdownSelection

        protected int getNotifDropdownSelection(int notifDays)
        Get what position the notification dropdown should be in based on what that field is set to in the Subscription.
        Parameters:
        notifDays - the number of days before the notification should go off
        Returns:
        the position the dropdown should be in, default is 0

      • getRechargeDropdownSelection

        protected int getRechargeDropdownSelection(int rechargeFreq)
        Get what position the recharge frequency dropdown should be in based on what that field is set to in the Subscription.
        Parameters:
        rechargeFreq - the number of months between charges
        Returns:
        the position the dropdown should be in, default is 0

      • getCategoryDropdownSelection

        protected int getCategoryDropdownSelection(Category category)
        Get what position the category dropdown should be in based on what that field is set to in the Subscription.
        Parameters:
        category - the object representing the category of the subscription
        Returns:
        the position the dropdown should be in, default is 0

      • displayErrorBar

        protected void displayErrorBar(android.view.View view,
                               int stringId)
        Display a small bar on the bottom of the screen. Should be called when there is something to display regarding a recent action (like improperly formatted input when submitting something). If view is null, nothing will display.
        Parameters:
        view - the current view of the application
        stringId - the string to display, should be in strings.xml

      • initializeCategories

        private void initializeCategories()
        Create each valid category object and add them to the category list. This is initialized here and not at the category list declaration so that we can call getColor().

      • initializeCategoryUI

        private void initializeCategoryUI()
        A helper function to initialize parts of the UI concerning category selection. This will populate the dropdown list with each valid category, then create the listener that will change the category color depending on the selected category.

      • initializeDatePickerUI

        private void initializeDatePickerUI()
        A helper function to initialize parts of the UI concerning the date picker. This will create the listener for the date picker, which causes a date selection to appear.
